caption:
This photograph captures a serene, outdoor scene by a body of water at twilight or early evening. Two young men are featured, each engaging in an activity along a rugged, wooden pier or jetty that extends into calm waters. The pier is constructed from wooden planks and beams.

The young man on the right, wearing a blue shirt and trousers, is seated on a wooden stump or block, focused on repairing or handling a fishing rod or some similar object. His attention is directed downwards towards his hands as he works.

The other young man, dressed in a white t-shirt and lighter-colored trousers, is squatting near the pier's edge, and appears to be handling something near the water, possibly tying a boat, working with fishing equipment, or engaging with the water directly.

The background reveals a tranquil water surface that mirrors the colors of the sky, suggesting sunset hues of blues and purples. On the left side of the image, there is a shoreline populated with various rocks, disarrayed logs, and sparse vegetation. A tree with a lean toward the water can also be observed, contributing to the natural, slightly untamed character of the setting.

The overall composition, with its mix of man-made structures and natural elements, together with the calm water and dimming light, creates a peaceful yet slightly melancholic atmosphere, capturing a moment of quiet activity and reflection amidst a rustic waterfront setting.
title: Children of shrimp fishermen
